source: #Purpose: simulate ETC protein decay and plot simulation results along with K50 values

#Import the required modules and functions
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
%matplotlib inline

#Read-in ETC protein half-life values
    #Note: the data is in the same format as presented in Table 1 of Karunadharma et al (2015) manuscript (DOI: 10.1096/fj.15-272666)

path = "path_to_csv_file"
half_lives = pd.read_csv(path, index_col="Age/treatment")

#Clean the dataset, remove unneccessary columns 

#Drop columns
cols_drop = ["Treatment averag;e % of YCL", "Unnamed: 9"] #specifies columns to drop
half_lives = half_lives.drop(axis=1, columns = cols_drop) #drops unnecessary columns

#Flip index and column axes
#half_lives = half_lives.rename_axis("Tissue_types") #renames the index axis (optional)
half_lives = half_lives.transpose() #flips column and index axes

source:
#Data cleaning: remove unneccessary characters from the data points, convert the data to float
    
#remove unneccessary characters from the data points
    #Use Regex to get rid of them
        #Extract porions of the strings with the following pattern
            #pattern = r"line_start-->digits or dots-->Space"
                #Extract just this pattern and save it to your df
        
pattern = r"(^[\d\.]+) " #pattern exlanation: r"Capture_group_opens-->line_start--> multiple digits or dots-->Empty_Space-->Capture_group_closes"

#Select the data from young control animals (YCL data) for further analysis
ycl = half_lives["YCL"]
print(ycl)

#Remove unneccessary characters from the data AND convert the data to numerical form
ycl = ycl.str.extract(pattern).astype("float").rename({0: "half_life"}, axis=1) #extracts just the characters of interest from the str + converts data to float type + renames the column
print("\nProcessed YCL data:")
print(ycl)

#Calculate the degradation rate (decay rate) constant from half-lives:

#Half-life to rate constant conversion formula, where "k" = rate constant:
#k = 0.693 / t½ 


ycl["decay_rate"] = 0.693 / ycl["half_life"]
print(ycl)

#Calculating low (slow) and high (fast) decay rates

mean_rates = {} #a dict storing mean rate values


mean_rates["low_rate"] = ycl.loc[ycl["decay_rate"] < 0.05, "decay_rate"].mean()
mean_rates["high_rate"] = ycl.loc[ycl["decay_rate"] > 0.05, "decay_rate"].mean()

print(mean_rates)


#Decay rate unit = population unit (in our case percentages) / day

#Create a function for simulating protein decay

#Define a function that will perform the simulations
def sim_etc_decay(rate, rate_name, end_time):
    '''
    Simulates ETC protein decay. Accepts rate, end_time as numerical data, rate_name as string data.
    Returns a Data Frame containing time point data and simulation results in separate columns
    '''
    data = {} #empty dict that will store simulation data
    etc_content = 100 #specifies initial ETC content and keeps track of changes in it
    time = range(0,end_time,1) #time range in days
    if etc_content >= 0: #we dont want for etc_content to drop below 0
        for t in time: #assigns the starting etc_content at t = 0 
            if t == 0:
                data[t] = etc_content
            else: #assigns subsequent etc_content values to t > 0
                etc_content = etc_content - etc_content * rate #calculates new etc content for each time point
                data[t] = etc_content #saves simulation result and associated timepoint to the dict
        data_df = pd.DataFrame(data.items(), columns=["time"+"_"+rate_name, "etc_content"+"_"+rate_name]) #converts dictionary into a df + defines column names 
    return data_df

#Run simulations and generate data
sim_data = pd.DataFrame() #empty df that will store simulation data


low_rate_data = sim_etc_decay(mean_rates["low_rate"], "low_rate", 130)
high_rate_data = sim_etc_decay(mean_rates["high_rate"], "high_rate", 50) 

print(sim_data)

#Plot the graphs with hlines representing K50 values
    #Note: plotting should be done using OO interface


fig, (ax1) = plt.subplots(nrows=1, ncols=1, figsize=(20,15))

ax1.plot(low_rate_data["time_low_rate"], low_rate_data["etc_content_low_rate"], linewidth = 3.5)
ax1.plot(high_rate_data["time_high_rate"], high_rate_data["etc_content_high_rate"], linewidth = 3.5)

ax1.set_xlim(0,130) #low rate data has higher xlim due to slower decay rate

axes = [ax1]
for ax in axes:
    ax.set_ylim(0,100) #sets identical ylim for both graphs
    ax.axhline(11.9, ls="dashed", color="grey", linewidth = 3.5) #Median K50
    ax.axhline(35.9, ls="dashed", color="grey", linewidth = 3.5) #Max K50
    ax.axhline(1.5, ls="dashed", color="grey", linewidth = 3.5) #Min K50

#Customize ticks for Low decay rate graph
ax1.set_xticks(range(0,120,5), minor=True) #sets minor ticks on x axis every 5 days
ax1.tick_params(axis='x',which='minor',direction='out',bottom=True,length=5) #specifies the length of minor ticks
ax1.tick_params(axis='x',which='major',direction='out',bottom=True,length=8) #specifies the length of major ticks

#ax1.set_yticks(range(0,110,10), minor=False) #sets major ticks on y axis 
ax1.set_yticks(range(0,100,5), minor=True) #sets minort ticks on y axis 
ax1.tick_params(axis='y',which='minor',direction='out',bottom=True,length=5) #specifies the length of minor ticks
ax1.tick_params(axis='y',which='major',direction='out',bottom=True,length=8) #specifies the length of major ticks

#Customize tick labels for Low decay rate graph: enlarge the tick labels
xlabels = range(0,140, 20) #creates a list of int labels
xlabels_str = map(str, xlabels) #converts int list to strings, so that they can be passed to ax1.set_xticklabels() function
ax1.set_xticklabels(xlabels_str, fontdict={'fontsize': 25,'fontweight':"bold"})

ylabels = range(0,110, 10) #creates a list of int labels
ylabels_str = map(str, xlabels) #converts int list to strings, so that they can be passed to ax1.set_xticklabels() function
ax1.set_yticklabels(ylabels_str, fontdict={'fontsize': 25,'fontweight':"bold"}, minor=False)
